Cooking Sites to Check Out!

  • The Reluctant Gourmet

    The Reluctant Gourmet is a great website for learning how to cook online. It teaches you various cooking techniques. It teaches you about baking, frying, roasting, sauces, grilling and so much more. The website also allows you to search for recipes based on meal types and learn about various ingredients used in culinary recipes.

  • Kitchn Cooking School

    Kitchn Cooking School is a great website for learning the basics of how to get started in the kitchen. For 20 days, it contains 20 lessons to help prepare you on how to cook and get started in the kitchen. In addition to written instructions and directions, it also contains videos which you can follow along to for each lesson. The website also allows you to browse and search various meals based on occasions, dish types, regional cuisines, view ingredients and find useful tips for kitchen essentials and how to keep it clean and organized.

  • Youtube

    Youtube has a ton of recipe video tutorials and even cooking channels dedicated to teaching others how to cook. Youtube is a great website to use if you prefer a visual cue on how to get started with cooking. Simply search the meal or recipe which you want to make.

  • Budget Bytes

    Budget Bytes contains a variety of different cheap and afforadable meals and recipes which you can make. The website has a cost estimate and breaks down the prices for each ingridient to see how much it would cost you. The website even allows you to tweak its servings so it suits your needs.

  • SuperCook

    SuperCook is a recipe search engine which lets you search for recipe and meals by ingridient which you have at home. It finds you recipes to use with as many of your ingridients as possible so nothing goes to watse.
